Event.name: Catching_fire
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Fuel</fen>, some flammable object or substance, ends up on fire. In this frame, the cause of the fire is not the primary concern, but rather the fact that a fire started. In rare cases, only the <fen>Fire</fen> is mentioned and the associated <fen>Fuel</fen> is not.
<ex></ex> This frame does not include phrases like "a fire broke out" or "the conflagration started in the bedroom" as these are deemed to be compositional (see Process_start and Fire_burning).</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> begins to burn.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> begins to burn.</def-root>

Arg.name: Fire
Arg.definition: <def-root>The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the <fen>Fuel</fen> currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.</def-root>

Arg.name: Fuel
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that is begins to undergo rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Fire event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A description of why the event happened.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: break out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (A fire) suddenly catches and spreads

lexUnit.name: catch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Begin to consume, with fire

lexUnit.name: catch fire.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Be introduced to, and subsequently consumed by, fire.

lexUnit.name: start.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: A fire catches unintentionally, usually viewed in past-tense.

lexUnit.name: combust.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. consume or be consumed by fire.
